page.title: 17Health Services in Alderney
page.content: The hospital was built in 1926 though it was very small.It would only fit up to eight beds.In 1958 the hospital was enlarged to fit 24 beds.36 people now work there - 23 nurses,5 kitchen staff,5 domestics,1 gardener,1 repair man and 1 washing lady.Altogether there are 10 night staff including three nurses.Patients are divided into two groups - casualties and geriatrics(old people).For big operations patients are sent to Guernsey and Southampton but small ones can be done here(like getting out moles).The commonest illnesses are bronchitis,strokes and heart attacks.You can visit children at all times but times are restricted for adults.There are four doctors - Dr Eagle,Dr Quanten and Drs Robertson.
